intro: Sisymbrium sophia var. sophioides, commonly known as sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate leaves that are oval to lance-shaped. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers with four petals, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed areas. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable plant for ecological gardens.
